intro: Sabatia gracilis var. stellaris, commonly known as the starflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, star-shaped blossoms that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. It produces small, oblong seeds that are dispersed by wind, aiding in its spread. Its botanical features make it a notable species for ecological studies and ornamental gardening.
